Patch Set 3:

Alex Wilson has raised the point that it would be more secure to sign a certificate for cmon authentication rather than add a key to the admin account - though this would also limit compatibility to newer cmon deployments.

Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

Abandoned

Superseded by https://cr.joyent.us/#/c/6144/.

All functionality here is there as well!
We now have Go 1.11.1 available. It looks like changes are minor, but there may be some performance benefit. Not a big deal either way.
Should this comment be updated to refer to Prometheus?
I would explicitly list the sapi json file here too
s/support/supports

Is it warranted to put definitions like this in a common file that's then sourced by both scripts? I don't feel strongly about this - especially since the scripts live in two separate locations, thus increasing the hassle.
indent this line, maybe?
Should this echo be more informative? Something like "cmon domain found: $cmonDomain"
We probably want to remove resolv.conf.new in the case where it doesn't differ.
see resolv.conf comment
I just realized - won't this overwrite any changes that the user has made manually to the config file, thus defeating the purpose of putting the config on a delegate dataset?
Is this purely for operator convenience?
I don't follow - won't this file always exist, thus always running the script?
Whitespace on blank line here. If this is just a copy-pasted file, this might exist in other repos too...
Same here.
